Dear Mr. Gage:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
December 18, 2020. Due to the violations, a written corrective action plan is required. It
should be noted that violations of any licensing statutes rules and are also violations of
the MISEP and your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of
this letter and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MISEP citation.
 Repeat violations require an explanation on why the previous corrective
action plan was unsuccessful.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, a regular license will be issued. If
you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action will result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 552-3662.

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
R 400.4113 Employee records.
An institution shall maintain employee records for each
employee and shall include documentation of all of the following
information prior to employment or at the time specified in this
rule:
(j) A written evaluation of the employee's performance within
30 days of the completion of the probationary period or within
180 days, whichever is less, and a written evaluation of the
employee’s performance annually thereafter.
Two of nineteen personnel records reviewed lacked a written evaluation in the
required time frame.
R 400.4114 Tuberculosis screening for employees and volunteers.
The licensee shall document, prior to employment, that each
employee and volunteer who has contact with residents 4 or
more hours per week for more than 2 consecutive weeks is free
from communicable tuberculosis. Freedom from communicable
tuberculosis shall be verified within the 1-year period before
employment and shall be verified every 1 year after the last
verification or prior to the expiration of the current verification.
Three of nineteen personnel records reviewed lacked current, or updated
tuberculosis screening completed timely.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
Interim Inspection Report Dated 1/8/20, CAP approval date 2/11/19
Renewal Inspection Report dated 1/8/19, CAP approval date 1/28/19

VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
The facility has submitted one acceptable corrective action plans not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period in response to the 2020 Interim Inspection.
The previous year’s citation for initial documentation, service plans, therapy contacts,
training and criminal history were corrected, and no citations were located during this
review. There were no special investigations during this period under review.
I completed a tour of the facility and found it to be fairly clean, and free of clutter.
There were a few small holes in the walls of the bedroom hallways but no insultation
or wires were exposed. I was informed maintenance would be repairing the holes.
The facility has contracted with outside cleaners during the pandemic who were
present and observed mopping floors and cleaning laundry. The meal menu was
posted and there was ample food located in the kitchen. All nine youth were
observed in the classroom and gym. The two youth that are verbal were interviewed,
but minimally engaged in the conversation. The youth appeared to be clean, and
appropriately dressed. Staff were observed to be wearing face mask and
appropriately engaging with the youth. The medication was stored securely. During
interviews with staff, they felt supported and adequate training was provided. Staff
felt the team worked well together and all youth and staff were safe at the facility.
5

VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules and/or MSA requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon
receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility will
be issued a renewal of their regular license.
